titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. William G. McCracking, Judgment
CWG5142

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
State of Kentucky Laurel Circuit Court
August Term 1864
Commonwealth Plff
Against } Grand Larceny
Wm G McCracking Defts

This day came the Attorney for the Commonwealth and the Defendant being brought into Court in custody of the Jailer and being asked if he had any thing further to urge why the Judgement of the Court shoud not be pronounced according to the verdict of the Jury Replied that he had not It is therefore adjudged by the court that the Defendant Wm G McCracking undergo Confinement in the Jail and Penetinchery of the State for and during the full Term and Period of four Years in manner and form as by the Jury in their verdict assessed That the Defendant now be remanded in custody of the Jailer to be kept by him until such time as the Sherriff of this county can remove him to the Penitinchery as aboved adjudged which shall be as soon as convenient!

A copy Att R L Ewell Clerk
Laurel Cir Court
Laurel Cir Ct
Commonwealth
v } Judgement
Wm G McCrackingRefused
